pros: Management is great! Stable company as well- hard to find in a hospital in Birmingham sometimes.
cons: A little bit old school- had paper charting until december 2017

job_title: Registered Nurse in Little Rock, AR
pros: I didn't have supervisors breathing down my neck
cons: Lack of supervisor isn't always a good thing

pros: A beautiful atrium and many offices to work for
cons: Low pay and doctors can be rude

pros: Great patient care given by staff
cons: Hours are long and hard

pros: Great environment, and I loved my experience there.
cons: The pay could be better.

pros: The pay is ok.  Patients are generally a delight to work with.
cons:
There is no seniority.  The more you are willing to learn and do, the more they make you do while other less motivated people get less work.  

Insurance may be cheaper but you have to use their Tier 1 doctors which there is not a lot of. You have to meet all deductible, not just your personal deductible ($500 deductible per person but have to meet $1000.00 if more than one person before it will kick in). Also, there is a separate and higher deductible for any other physician not in their Tier 1 network.  My deductibles are $1800/year. My plus one never goes to the doctor.  

The hospital is falling apart.  Equipment, including beds is not in good condition.  Rips in mattresses are not taken care of,

review_title: Answers to a tough corporate parent: Ascension Health (AH).  AH raises the minimum profit margin each year.
pros: Most of the employees care about and are focused on delivering high quality care to the patients.  There are still areas of this health system that mirror the company values of service of the poor, reverence, integrity, wisdom, creativity and dedication.
cons: Cut-backs, "cost saving measures", diminishing benefits that cost more each year fore employees, and large reduction of workforce waves have become a regular phenomena.  The operations business model they follow is not sustainable for future stability.  Serious, difficult and painful decisions will have to be made in order to give this company a better chance of stabilizing economically.

review_title: The people are there -- the planning is not.
pros: Some of the best people you will ever work with.  Great middle- to upper-middle management.  Once you go above Director level in this organization -- the touch is lost.
cons: Instability in the marketplace -- inflexibility of answering to Ascension does not allow for agility in the marketplace.  Some of the strategic planning is way way off.  There has been some turnover at the top, so maybe this changes in the near future, but they lost Alabama Cardiovascular back in 2015/2016 and it has taken this long to realize what is wrong financially.  You can't hire two cardiologists to replace a practice of nearly 20.

pros: The fact that you are taking care of the community be it friends, family or any of God's children is quite remarkable.
cons: The system changed to paperless and heavy computer adherence applied with the frequent system failure, upgrades, equipment malfunction, and inconvenience of placement has dislodged any humanity to nursing.

pros: Parking lot for associates. Most of the nurses truly care about their patients. Variety of areas to work and learn.
cons: Pay scale is too low. Overworked and understaffed. Areas of the hospital really need to be updated. Generally feels dirty and since the housekeeping staff is employed by another company, this never seems to improve. They really need to hire housekeepers that take pride in their work.

review_title: I have grown so much with this company.
pros:
Great benefits! 
good 401 b
raises almost every year
friendly christian place to work
management went beyond means to accomadate school needs
tution rembuisement
cons:
consant budget cuts to every department including much needed staff.
raises are small and rare sometimes once a year sometimes once every two, not normally based on work performance.

pros: The people working there are great. They care about their patients and their outcomes.
cons: There is no staff. They service the top athletes in the world and have staff working beyond reasonable hours to ensure they maintain a top ranking in sports related surgeries. You can NOT have a family. This job is for singles or someone without a family. The hours are leave at 6am and come home after 8pm of you are lucky. Stay away.

review_title: St. Vincent Health System fails it"s employees.
pros: As a nurse I can provide care to the weak and sick.  I am able to work with the best .
cons: Short staffed and long hours.    Nurses  not only work these long hours but  many times without breaks, not even lunch.

review_title: St vincents is greedy and is changing everything for the worse of the employee.
job_title: X Ray Tech in Birmingham, AL
pros: friendly atmosphere,like the people I work with
cons: terrible insurance,never get raises, underappreciated,they only care about making money and could care less if the employee is homeless on the street!

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Birmingham, AL
pros: Benefits they offer is 80% paid by employer.  No vision coverage until after a year.  Uniform allowance once a year. But the caught the monogram each.
cons: HUGE turnover. Pay offered should be so much more. Not understanding why they are not upping the pay scale. No vision for 1 year.  It acceptable.

pros:
Nice people to work with
Mission Statement lived out by co-workers
Patient care by workers is enforced & focused on
cons:
Catholic Hospital, but never begins prayer with the sign of the cross
No room for growth - manager has to die or leave for internal promotion to occur

pros: I enjoy caring for others.  I also love the medical field.  I am very friendly and get along well with others.
cons: I dislike working with a lot of drama but I guess that's everywhere you go.

pros: Good pay, could swap shifts just write it out.
cons: Gave my two weeks. Three days later was told to email it through their portal email. Didn't go back to work for 5 days I emailed it then with same last day. Manager kept me scheduled for two weeks after my last day.

review_title: Do not come to work here!
pros: Great nurses, opportunities to pick up extra shifts, decent health insurance.
cons: Low pay, chaotic working enviorment, clueless HR department, mean and thankless patients, Barney Fife like security guards, and very rude doctor's.

pros: Great cardiac and orthopedic hospital.
cons: Low level of job promotions as a Respiratory therapist.  Nursing hospital so there is very limited respect. 1 therapist for 3-4 areas.

review_title: Med Lab Assistant. ... collection of blood.
job_title: Med Lab Assistant in Birmingham, AL
pros: Great hours, I love working 7on 7off. Great coworkers. Management is decent.
cons: They do not pay very well. Which seems to be a trend at most hospitals around Alabama.  We are often understaffed.
